snippet: A fleet of vessels would provide electricity to remote locations, including disputed islands in the South China Sea, the state news media said.
abstract: State-owned China Shipbuilding Industry Corp is planning to build fleet of floating nuclear power plants on chain of man-made islands in South China Sea; plan, which could generate considerable amount of electricity China says is needed to power radar systems, barracks and airfields, comes under fire amid safety concerns.
lead_paragraph: A fleet of vessels would provide electricity to remote locations, including disputed islands in the South China Sea, the state news media said.

headline.main: China to Develop Floating Nuclear Power Plants
headline.print_headline: China Plans Power Plants on the Sea for Islands
